companion noun [C]
(PERSON)

B2 a person you spend a lot of time with often because you are friends or because you are travelling together: The dog has been her constant companion these past ten years. a travelling companion Synonyms
buddy informal
chum (FRIEND) old-fashioned informal
crony informal disapproving
friend (PERSON YOU LIKE)
mate (FRIEND) UK informal
mucker UK informal
pal informalCompare
acquaintance
in the past, a young woman who was paid to care for and provide friendship for an old or ill woman, especially while she was travelling
More examplesFewer examplesShe went travelling with a female companion.Mabel will be a good companion for my mother.He was hired to act as Gerald's companion.He has been her constant companion for over 50 years.
